subject: History
title: The Paris Commune
description: A fast breakdown of The Paris Commune for builders.

hook.text: For 72 days in 1871, workers ran Paris as a socialist experiment. The French army ended it with 20,000 dead.

buildup.text: After France's humiliating defeat by Prussia, Parisians refused to surrender. They formed their own government.

discovery.text: The Commune introduced free education, workers' cooperatives, and separated church from state.

twist.text: The French government, not the Prussians, sent troops to destroy the Commune. The 'Bloody Week' killed thousands.

climax.text: Marx called it the first workers' government. Lenin studied it obsessively. It became communism's founding myth.

punchline.text: Seventy-two days inspired a century of revolution.

quiz.question: Who destroyed the Paris Commune in 1871?
options: The Prussian army that had besieged Paris
A royalist counter-revolution from the provinces
